contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Kitakanbara'''|北蒲原郡|Kitakanbara-gun}} is a [[districts of Japan|district]] located in [[Niigata Prefecture|Niigata]], [[Japan]]. As of April 1, 2005, the district has an estimated [[population]] of 13,528. The total area is 37.99 km². The district has one town: [[Seirō, Niigata|Seirō]]. == History == * On January 1, 1947, the town of [[Shibata, Niigata|Shibata]] became a city. After it gained city status, Shibata and [[Niigata, Niigata|Niigata]] merged to form the city known as Shibata. The surrounding areas and the district continued to lose more areas. * On November 1, 1970, the town of [[Toyosaka, Niigata|Toyosaka]] (part of [[Niigata, Niigata|Niigata]] as of March 21, 2005) gained city status. * On July 7, 2003, the town of [[Toyoura, Niigata|Toyoura]] merged into the city of [[Shibata, Niigata|Shibata]]. * On April 1, 2004, the towns of [[Suibara, Niigata|Suibara]] and [[Yasuda, Niigata|Yasuda]], and the villages of [[Kyogase, Niigata|Kyogase]] and [[Sasakami, Niigata|Sasakami]] merged to create the city of [[Agano, Niigata|Agano]]. * On May 1, 2005, the town of [[Shiunji, Niigata|Shiunji]] and the village of [[Kajikawa, Niigata|Kajikawa]] were also merged into the city of [[Shibata, Niigata|Shibata]]. * On September 1, 2005, the town of [[Nakajo, Niigata|Nakajō]] and the village of [[Kurokawa, Niigata|Kurokawa]] merged to form the city of [[Tainai, Niigata|Tainai]], which left [[Seirō, Niigata|Seirō]] as the only town in Kitakanbara District. == External links == * [http://www.ssk-gappei.com/ 新発田市・紫雲寺町・加治川村合併協議会]{{ja icon}} * [http://www.town.nakajo.niigata.jp/gappei/ 中条町・黒川村合併協議会]{{Deadlink|date=August 2011}} {{Niigata}} {{coord|37.9810|N|139.264|E|type:landmark_source:itwiki|display=title}} [[Category:Districts in Niigata Prefecture]]
